trans-unit.source: Application Insights for ASP.NET 5
trans-unit.target: Application Insights for ASP.NET 5

trans-unit.source: Monitor web applications for availability, performance and usage.
trans-unit.target: Monitor web applications for availability, performance and usage.

trans-unit.source: Application Insights for ASP.NET 5
trans-unit.target: Application Insights for ASP.NET 5

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio Application Insights lets you monitor your web application for availability, performance and usage.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio Application Insights lets you monitor your web application for availability, performance and usage.

trans-unit.source: With the feedback you get about the performance and effectiveness of your app in the wild, you can make informed choices about the direction of the design in each development lifecycle.
trans-unit.target: With the feedback you get about the performance and effectiveness of your app in the wild, you can make informed choices about the direction of the design in each development lifecycle.

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: You'll need a subscription with [Microsoft Azure](http://azure.com).
trans-unit.target: You'll need a subscription with [Microsoft Azure](http://azure.com).

trans-unit.source: Sign in with a Microsoft account, which you might have for Windows, XBox Live, or other Microsoft cloud services.
trans-unit.target: Sign in with a Microsoft account, which you might have for Windows, XBox Live, or other Microsoft cloud services.

trans-unit.source: Create an ASP.NET 5 project
trans-unit.target: Create an ASP.NET 5 project

trans-unit.source: ... if you haven't already done that.
trans-unit.target: ... if you haven't already done that.

trans-unit.source: Use the standard ASP.NET 5 project template in Visual Studio 2015.
trans-unit.target: Use the standard ASP.NET 5 project template in Visual Studio 2015.

trans-unit.source: Create an Application Insights resource
trans-unit.target: Create an Application Insights resource

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure portal][portal], create a new Application Insights resource.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure portal][portal], create a new Application Insights resource.

trans-unit.source: Pick the ASP.NET option.
trans-unit.target: Pick the ASP.NET option.

trans-unit.source: Click New, Developer services, Application Insights
trans-unit.target: Click New, Developer services, Application Insights

trans-unit.source: The [resource][roles] blade that opens is the place where you'll see performance and usage data about your app.
trans-unit.target: The [resource][roles] blade that opens is the place where you'll see performance and usage data about your app.

trans-unit.source: To get back to it next time you login to Azure, you should find a tile for it on the start screen.
trans-unit.target: To get back to it next time you login to Azure, you should find a tile for it on the start screen.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively click Browse to find it.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively click Browse to find it.

trans-unit.source: The choice of application type sets the default content of the resource blades and the properties visible in [Metrics Explorer][metrics].
trans-unit.target: The choice of application type sets the default content of the resource blades and the properties visible in [Metrics Explorer][metrics].

trans-unit.source: Configure your project with the Instrumentation Key.
trans-unit.target: Configure your project with the Instrumentation Key.

trans-unit.source: Copy the key from your Application Insights resource:
trans-unit.target: Copy the key from your Application Insights resource:

trans-unit.source: Click Properties, select the key, and press ctrl+C
trans-unit.target: Click Properties, select the key, and press ctrl+C

trans-unit.source: In your ASP.NET 5 project, paste it into `config.json`:
trans-unit.target: In your ASP.NET 5 project, paste it into `config.json`:

trans-unit.source: Or if you’d prefer the configuration to be dynamic, you can add this code to the application’s Startup class:
trans-unit.target: Or if you’d prefer the configuration to be dynamic, you can add this code to the application’s Startup class:

trans-unit.source: Add Application Insights to your project
trans-unit.target: Add Application Insights to your project

trans-unit.source: Reference the NuGet package
trans-unit.target: Reference the NuGet package

trans-unit.source: Find the [latest release number](https://github.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-aspnet5/releases) of the NuGet package.
trans-unit.target: Find the [latest release number](https://github.com/Microsoft/ApplicationInsights-aspnet5/releases) of the NuGet package.

trans-unit.source: Open `project.json` and edit the `dependencies` section:
trans-unit.target: Open `project.json` and edit the `dependencies` section:

trans-unit.source: Parse the configuration file
trans-unit.target: Parse the configuration file

trans-unit.source: In `startup.cs`:
trans-unit.target: In `startup.cs`:

trans-unit.source: In the `Startup` method:
trans-unit.target: In the `Startup` method:

trans-unit.source: In the `ConfigurationServices` method:
trans-unit.target: In the `ConfigurationServices` method:

trans-unit.source: In the `Configure` method:
trans-unit.target: In the `Configure` method:

trans-unit.source: Add JavaScript client instrumentation
trans-unit.target: Add JavaScript client instrumentation

trans-unit.source: If you have a _Layout.cshtml file, insert the following code there.
trans-unit.target: If you have a _Layout.cshtml file, insert the following code there.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, put the code in any page that you want to track.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, put the code in any page that you want to track.

trans-unit.source: Define injection in the very top of the file:
trans-unit.target: Define injection in the very top of the file:

trans-unit.source: Insert the Html helper before the `</head>` tag, and before any other script.
trans-unit.target: Insert the Html helper before the `</head>` tag, and before any other script.

trans-unit.source: Any custom JavaScript telemetry you want to report from the page should be injected after this snippet:
trans-unit.target: Any custom JavaScript telemetry you want to report from the page should be injected after this snippet:

trans-unit.source: Run your app
trans-unit.target: Run your app

trans-unit.source: Debug your application in Visual Studio, or publish it to your web server.
trans-unit.target: Debug your application in Visual Studio, or publish it to your web server.

trans-unit.source: View data about your app
trans-unit.target: View data about your app

trans-unit.source: Return to the [Azure portal][portal] and browse to your Application Insights resource.
trans-unit.target: Return to the [Azure portal][portal] and browse to your Application Insights resource.

trans-unit.source: If there is no data in the Overview blade, wait a minute or two and click Refresh.
trans-unit.target: If there is no data in the Overview blade, wait a minute or two and click Refresh.

trans-unit.source: [Track usage of your app][usage]
trans-unit.target: [Track usage of your app][usage]

trans-unit.source: [Diagnose performance issues][detect]
trans-unit.target: [Diagnose performance issues][detect]

trans-unit.target: [Set up web tests to monitor availability][availability]
